activities:
StarCite helps all parties realize the opportunities available in the effective management of meetings and events.
StarCite licenses its technology to organizations (its “Corporate Clients” or “Licensees”) including third- party meeting planning organizations, universities, corporations and businesses, associations, government organizations, and co-brand partners. 
StarCite also provides access to its applications to suppliers of services to Corporate Clients (“Suppliers”). These suppliers include hotels, convention and visitors bureaus, destination management companies, and other providers of services needed by its Corporate Clients.
Individuals (“Buyers”) use this technology on behalf of Corporate Clients to manage meetings, and to purchase services for these meetings and events from suppliers.
contacttitle1: SVP Global Architecture, Data and Security
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
recoursemech: For any dispute that are not resolved after being brought to the attention of StarCite management, StarCite has agreed to submit those disputes to binding arbitration administered by TRUSTe (www.truste.org) at http://www.truste.org/consumers/watchdog_complaint.php. TRUSTe EU Safe Harbor program will then serve as a liaison with StarCite to resolve your concerns.
